sub_topic: Determining the isomerism of a molecule
message_1: Identify the type of isomerism present in the molecule C3H6O and draw all possible isomers.
message_2:
The molecule C3H6O can exhibit functional group isomerism. There are two functional groups possible for this molecular formula: aldehyde (R-CHO) and ketone (R-CO-R). 

Here are the possible isomers:

1. Propanal (an aldehyde)
   H3C-CH2-CHO

2. Propanone (a ketone)
   H3C-CO-CH3

These are the two possible isomers of C3H6O, exhibiting functional group isomerism.
